movies.description: In this adaptation of the Henry James novel set in 19th-century New York City, a wealthy spinster with an overbearing father is pursued by a handsome fortune hunter who may be only after her money.

movies.title: The Man Who Knew Too Little (1997)
movies.description: Wallace Ritchie is mistaken for a spy and must stop a plot to assassinate international leaders at a banquet.

movies.title: The Waterboy (1998)
movies.description: A waterboy for a college football team discovers he has a unique tackling ability and becomes a member of the team.

movies.title: Welcome to Sarajevo (1997)
movies.description: American and British journalists Flynn and Michael Henderson, along with their respective news teams, meet at the beginning of the Bosnian war in Sarajevo. During their reports, the group find an orphanage run by the devoted Mrs. Savic near the frontline. Feeling sympathy, Henderson decides to take one of the children, Emira, illegally back to England.

movies.title: Welcome to Woop Woop (1997)
movies.description: A con artist escapes a deal gone wrong in New York and winds up in the Aussie outback in a strange town whose inhabitants are an oddball collection of misfits.

movies.title: Wide Awake (1998)
movies.description: A 10-year-old boy goes on a search for God after his grandfather dies.

movies.title: Wild America (1997)
movies.description: Three brothers who are obsessed with animals are given permission from their parents to travel around America with a camera documenting wildlife.

movies.title: Wilde (1997)
movies.description: The turmoil in poet/playwright Oscar Wilde's life after he discovers his homosexuality.

movies.title: The Wings of the Dove (1997)
movies.description: An impoverished woman who has been forced to choose between a privileged life with her wealthy aunt and her journalist lover, befriends an American heiress. When she discovers the heiress is attracted to her own lover and is dying, she sees a chance to have both the privileged life she cannot give up and the lover she cannot live without.

movies.title: The Winter Guest (1997)
movies.description: A recent widow, who is determined to leave Scotland for Australia with her son, gets an unexpected visit from her aging mother.

movies.title: Wishmaster (1997)
movies.description: A demonic djinn attempts to grant its owner three wishes, which will allow him to summon his brethren to Earth.

movies.title: Wonderland (1997)
movies.description: The director interviews residents of the Levittown community, which was intended to be an affordable housing community for soldiers returning from war. Several communities were built in the 1940s and 1950s, on the east coast.

movies.title: Woo (1998)
movies.description: Gorgeous and extravert Woo meets insecure and straight-laced law clerk Tim at a blind date.

movies.title: Celebrity (1998)
movies.description: The fortunes of a husband and wife differ drastically after they divorce.

movies.title: The Wrong Guy (1997)
movies.description: After his boss is murdered, Nelson is on the run for fear of prosecution. He hides out in a small town to avoid the police, which should be easy because they know he didn't do it and they aren't looking for him.

movies.title: Year of the Horse (1997)
movies.description: This film documents Neil Young and Crazy Horse's 1996 concert tour. Jim Jarmusch interviews the band about their long history, and we see backstage footage from the 1970s and 1980s.

movies.title: Zeus and Roxanne (1997)
movies.description: A touching friendship story between a dog and a dolphin.

movies.title: Zone 39 (1996)
movies.description: In a time of misery and fear two enemies come together to prevent an apocalypse conspired by their leaders. 40 years of war between the Federated Republics and the New Territories Union has taken its toll. The cities are overcrowded, farming land is riddled with unexploded mines -- and still there is no hope of peace. In this hostile, decaying world of the future on t...Read all

movies.title: Dance with Me (1998)
movies.description: Rafael Infante (Chayanne) comes to Houston from Cuba to work at John Burnett's (Kris Kristofferson's) dance studio. He meets Ruby Sinclair (Vanessa Williams), a cute dance instructor there. Chemistry? Will John know he's Rafael's dad?
The famous 1970s New York City nightclub seen and told through the eyes of a young employee.

movies.title: American History X (1998)
movies.description: Living a life marked by violence, neo-Nazi Derek finally goes to prison after killing two black youths. Upon his release, Derek vows to change; he hopes to prevent his brother, Danny, who idolizes Derek, from following in his footsteps.

movies.title: Antz (1998)
movies.description: A rather neurotic ant tries to break from his totalitarian society while trying to win the affection of the princess he loves.

movies.title: Armageddon (1998)
movies.description: After discovering that an asteroid the size of Texas will impact Earth in less than a month, NASA recruits a misfit team of deep-core drillers to save the planet.

movies.title: The Autumn Heart (1999)
movies.description: When a school bus driving woman (Tyne Daly) has a heart attack, she makes one request of her three daughters (Ally Sheedy, Marla Sucharetza, Marceline Hugo) - she wants them to find their long lost brother, who was taken away by their father (Jack Davidson) 16 years ago. What they discover is that while they have struggled, their father has become a wealthy man and th...Read all

movies.title: B. Monkey (1998)
movies.description: A young woman attempts to end her criminal career. But she needs love to make it.

movies.title: Babe: Pig in the City (1998)
movies.description: Babe, fresh from his victory in the sheepherding contest, returns to Farmer Hoggett's farm, but after Farmer Hoggett is injured and unable to work, Babe has to go to the big city to save the farm.

movies.title: The Bachelor (1999)
movies.description: A commitment-phobic man goes in search of a bride, including his fed-up girlfriend, to inherit his grandfather's one hundred million dollar inheritance.

movies.title: Barney's Great Adventure (1998)
movies.description: A talking purple dinosaur leads a group of children on a hunt for a large missing egg.

movies.title: Being John Malkovich (1999)
movies.description: A puppeteer discovers a portal that leads literally into the head of movie star John Malkovich.

movies.title: Beloved (1998)
movies.description: A slave is visited by the spirit of a mysterious young woman.

movies.title: The Big Hit (1998)
movies.description: Socially anxious hitman Melvin Smiley, an expert in his lucrative field, goes on a job and falls in love with his kidnapping victim, turning his world upside down.

movies.title: Black Dog (1998)
movies.description: A weapons loaded truck is shadowed by FBI and ATF. It explodes and kills the driver. Jack, just out of prison, is pressured into driving another truck from Atlanta to NJ. Things get rough when hijacking attempts are made.

movies.title: Blade (1998)
movies.description: A half-vampire, half-mortal man becomes a protector of the mortal race, while slaying evil vampires.

movies.title: A Walk on the Moon (1999)
movies.description: The world of a young housewife is turned upside down when she has an affair with a free-spirited blouse salesman.

movies.title: The Mummy (1999)
movies.description: At an archaeological dig in the ancient city of Hamunaptra, an American serving in the French Foreign Legion accidentally awakens a mummy who begins to wreak havoc as he searches for the reincarnation of his long-lost love.

movies.title: Breakfast of Champions (1999)
movies.description: A rich car dealer is losing his mind. His son lives in the bomb shelter. His suicidal wife has an affair with his transvestite sales manager.

movies.title: Brokedown Palace (1999)
movies.description: Two women are arrested for smuggling while vacationing in Thailand.

movies.title: A Bug's Life (1998)
movies.description: A misfit ant, looking for "warriors" to save his colony from greedy grasshoppers, recruits a group of bugs that turn out to be an inept circus troupe.

movies.title: Chicken Run (2000)
movies.description: When a cockerel apparently flies into a chicken farm, the chickens see him as an opportunity to escape their evil owners.

movies.title: Ever After: A Cinderella Story (1998)

movies.title: City of Angels (1998)
movies.description: An angel on Earth, a doctor unable to believe, a patient with a secret, a love story made in Heaven.

movies.title: A Civil Action (1998)
movies.description: At the risk of bankrupting his firm and career, lawyer Jan Schlichtman takes on a case involving two companies responsible for causing children to be diagnosed with leukemia due to the town's contaminated water supply.

movies.title: A Cool, Dry Place (1998)

movies.title: Dancing at Lughnasa (1998)
movies.description: Five unmarried sisters make the most of their simple existence in rural Ireland in the 1930s.

movies.title: Meet the Deedles (1998)
movies.description: Two surfers end up as Yellowstone park rangers and have to stop a former ranger who is out for revenge.

movies.title: The Deep End of the Ocean (1999)
movies.description: A family's reaction when Ben, the youngest son, is kidnapped and then found nine years later living in the same town where his family had just moved.

movies.title: Deep Impact (1998)
movies.description: A comet is discovered to be on a collision course with Earth. As doomsday nears, the human race prepares for the worst.

movies.title: Dirty Work (1998)
movies.description: A loser finds success in the revenge-for-hire business.

movies.title: Dogma (1999)
movies.description: An abortion clinic worker with a special heritage is called upon to save the existence of humanity from being negated by two renegade angels trying to exploit a loop-hole and reenter Heaven.

movies.title: The 13th Warrior (1999)

movies.title: Endurance (1999)
movies.description: The gold medal for the men's 10,000-metre race in the 1996 Atlanta Olympics is won by Ethiopian Haile Gebrselassie.

movies.title: Enemy of the State (1998)
movies.description: A lawyer becomes targeted by a corrupt politician and his N.S.A. goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a politically motivated crime.

The film depicts their lengthy preparations for the climb, their trek to the summit, and their successful return to Base Camp. It also shows many of the challenges the group faced, including avalanches, lack of oxygen, treacherous ice walls, and a deadly blizzard.

movies.title: Eye of the Beholder (1999)
movies.description: A private eye shadows a female serial killer of men all over the U.S. without her knowing as he, strangely enough, occasionally acts as her guardian angel.

movies.title: Eyes Wide Shut (1999)
movies.description: A Manhattan doctor embarks on a bizarre, night-long odyssey after his wife's admission of unfulfilled longing.

movies.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas (1998)
movies.description: An oddball journalist and his psychopathic lawyer travel to Las Vegas for a series of psychedelic escapades.

movies.title: Firestorm (1998)

movies.title: Frida (2002)
movies.description: A biography of artist Frida Kahlo, who channeled the pain of a crippling injury and her tempestuous marriage into her work.

movies.title: Frogs for Snakes (1998)
movies.description: Eva is a legit actress who does debt-collecting jobs on the side for her ex-husband, loan shark Al. She doesn't want to go on with collecting, but Al asks her to do one last job: finding a missing $600,000 stolen from him by Flav.

movies.title: From Hell (2001)
movies.description: After five ritualistic murders are committed in 1888 London, Inspector Abberline's assignment is to investigate the "Jack the Ripper" murders. Along with a string of mutilated prostitutes, he uncovers a conspiracy involving the government.

movies.title: Gloria (1999)
movies.description: After serving three years in prison covering for her gangster boyfriend, Kevin, Gloria returns to New York City for the money she was promised. Inside Kevin's base of operations, she finds 7-year-old Nicky, whose family has been killed.

movies.title: Gods and Monsters (1998)
movies.description: The last days of Frankenstein (1931) director James Whale are explored.

movies.title: Godzilla (1998)

movies.title: Stepmom (1998)
movies.description: A terminally ill woman must deal with her ex-husband's new lover, who will be their children's stepmother.

movies.title: The Governess (1998)
movies.description: In this sensuous romance, Minnie Driver stars as a governess who is hired into a remote Scottish household and strongly affects all those she comes into contact with.

movies.title: The Green Mile (1999)
movies.description: Paul Edgecomb, the head death row guard at a prison in 1930s Louisiana, meets an inmate, John Coffey, a black man who is accused of murdering two girls. His life changes drastically when he discovers that John has a special gift.

movies.description: In the 1960s, a group of friends at an all girls school learn that their school is going to be combined with a nearby all boys school. They concoct a plan to save their school while dealing with everyday problems along the way.

movies.title: Half Baked (1998)
movies.description: The story of three not so bright men who come up with a series of crazy schemes to get a friend out of jail.

movies.title: Halloween H20: 20 Years Later (1998)
movies.description: Laurie Strode, now the dean of a Northern California private school with an assumed name, must battle the Shape one last time, as the life of her own son hangs in the balance.

movies.title: Hard Rain (1998)
movies.description: The partner and nephew of an armored-truck driver tries to prevent three million dollars from being taken by a gang during a catastrophic flooding caused by a severe storm.

movies.title: Heaven (1998)
movies.description: Robert's wife is divorcing him for gambling etc. A strip club owner offers him work redesigning his club. Robert befriends a dancer there, who has premonitions.

movies.title: The Hi-Lo Country (1998)
movies.description: Two cowboys have their friendship tested when they fall for the same girl.

movies.title: Holy Man (1998)
movies.description: An over-the-top television evangelist finds a way to turn television home shopping into a religious experience, and takes America by storm.

movies.title: How Stella Got Her Groove Back (1998)
movies.description: Stella is a highly successful, forty-something San Francisco stock broker who is persuaded by her colorful New York girlfriend Delilah to take a well deserved, first-class vacation to Jamaica.

movies.title: The General (1998)
movies.description: The real-life story of Dublin folk hero and criminal Martin Cahill, who pulled off two daring robberies in Ireland with his team, but attracted unwanted attention from the police, the I.R.A., the U.V.F., and members of his own team.

movies.title: Ride (1998)
movies.description: A group of young people take an old bus from Harlem to Miami to make a rap music video there.

movies.title: Illuminata (1998)
movies.description: A turn-of-the-20th-century theatre repertory company rejects the latest project of their beloved playwright Tuccio, kicking off a saga of intrigue surrounding the influential critic Bevalaqua and star Celimene.

movies.title: In Dreams (1999)
movies.description: A suburban housewife learns that she has a dreamworld connection to a serial murderer, and must stop him from killing again.

movies.title: Jakob the Liar (1999)
movies.description: During World War II, an ordinary inhabitant of a ghetto fakes news about Allied offensives to inspire hope for other victims of the Nazi regime.

movies.title: Living Out Loud (1998)
movies.description: Judith, a wife betrayed by her unfaithful husband, finds solace in a nightclub singer's advice. A random kiss awakens her to new possibilities, igniting an attraction to her apartment's elevator operator.

movies.title: Kissing a Fool (1998)
movies.description: Writer Jay and womanizing sportscaster Max have been friends since birth. Jay introduces his editor Samantha to Max and they hit it off. Max wants Jay to try to seduce Sam to test her before their wedding.

movies.title: Knock Off (1998)
movies.description: A fashion designer must join forces with a C.I.A. agent to combat terrorism.

movies.title: Krippendorf's Tribe (1998)
movies.description: An anthropologist creates a fictitious lost New Guinea tribe using his family members to cover-up for his misuse of grant monies.

movies.title: The Last Days of Disco (1998)
movies.description: Story of two female Manhattan book editors fresh out of college, both finding love and themselves while frequenting the local disco.

movies.title: La leggenda del pianista sull'oceano (1998)
movies.description: A baby boy discovered on an ocean liner in 1900 grows into a musical prodigy, never setting foot on land.

movies.title: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels (1998)
movies.description: When four small-time criminals lose a rigged poker game against a London kingpin, he gives them one week to settle their enormous debt.

movies.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (2001)
movies.description: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

movies.title: Lost in Space (1998)
movies.description: The Robinson family was going into space to fight for a chance for humanity. Now they are fighting to live long enough to find a way home.

movies.title: Mafia! (1998)
movies.description: Takeoff on the Godfather with the son of a mafia king taking over for his dying father.

movies.title: Major League: Back to the Minors (1998)
movies.description: A lousy minor-league baseball team bursting with diverse personalities gets a new manager: an aging minor-league pitcher.

movies.title: The Man in the Iron Mask (1998)
movies.description: The cruel King Louis XIV of France has a secret twin brother whom he keeps imprisoned. Can the twin be substituted for the real king?

movies.title: The Mask of Zorro (1998)
movies.description: A young thief seeking revenge for his brother's death is trained by the once-great, aging Zorro, who is pursuing his own vengeance.

movies.title: The Very Thought of You (1998)
movies.description: Three childhood friends separately fall for cute American Martha, and within three days of her arrival at a London airport, their friendship is at risk.

movies.title: Mercury Rising (1998)
movies.description: Shadowy elements in the NSA target a nine-year old autistic savant for death when he is able to decipher a top secret code.

movies.title: Mighty Joe Young (1998)
movies.description: A legendary fifteen-foot tall mountain gorilla named Joe is taken to an animal sanctuary in California by zoologist Gregg O'Hara (Bill Paxton) and Jill Young (Charlize Theron), with whom he grew up. Poacher Strasser (Rade Serbedzija) returns from the past to seek vengeance on Joe.

movies.title: The Million Dollar Hotel (2000)
movies.description: Tragi-comic, romantic whodunnit set in a run down hotel which plays host to mentally ill people too poor to afford medical insurance.

movies.title: Mission: Impossible II (2000)
movies.description: IMF agent Ethan Hunt is sent to Sydney to find and destroy a genetically modified disease called "Chimera".

movies.title: The Mod Squad (1999)

movies.title: Mulan (1998)
movies.description: To save her father from death in the army, a young maiden secretly goes in his place and becomes one of China's greatest heroines in the process.

movies.title: My Favorite Martian (1999)
movies.description: A Martian lands on Earth and makes friends with a reporter.

movies.title: My Giant (1998)
movies.description: Billy Crystal plays a Hollywood agent who stumbles upon Max, a giant living in Romania, and tries to get him into the movies.

movies.title: The Naked Man (1998)
movies.description: A man takes matters into his own hands when a pharmaceutical kingpin moves into his town to cause some real trouble.

movies.title: The Negotiator (1998)
movies.description: In a desperate attempt to prove his innocence, a skilled police negotiator accused of corruption and murder takes hostages in a government office to gain the time he needs to find the truth.

movies.title: The Newton Boys (1998)
movies.description: The story of the Newton gang, the most successful bank robbers in history, owing to their good planning and minimal violence.

movies.title: A Night at the Roxbury (1998)
movies.description: Two dim-witted brothers dream of owning their own dance club or at least getting into the coolest and most exclusive club in town, The Roxbury.

movies.title: The Object of My Affection (1998)
movies.description: A pregnullt New York City social worker begins to develop romantic feelings for her gay best friend, and decides she'd rather raise her child with him, much to the dismay of her overbearing boyfriend.

movies.title: The Odd Couple II (1998)
movies.description: Oscar and Felix take a road trip to their son and daughter's wedding.

movies.title: One Man's Hero (1999)
movies.description: John Riley, an Irish immigrant soldier recruited in the American army during the Mexican-American War faces anti-immigrant and anti-Catholic bigotry from his fellow servicemen and defects to the Mexican army.

movies.title: One True Thing (1998)
movies.description: A career woman reassesses her parents' lives after she is forced to care for her cancer-stricken mother.

movies.title: The Opposite of Sex (1998)
movies.description: A 16-year-old girl visits her gay half-brother and ends up seducing his boyfriend, thus wreaking havoc on all of their lives.

movies.title: Out of Sight (1998)
movies.description: A career bank robber breaks out of jail, and shares a moment of mutual attraction with a U.S. Marshal he has kidnapped.

movies.title: Palmetto (1998)
movies.description: A recently released ex-con gets involved in a fake kidnapping scheme that turns very real.

movies.title: The Parent Trap (1998)
movies.description: Identical twins Annie and Hallie, separated at birth and each raised by one of their biological parents, discover each other for the first time at summer camp and make a plan to bring their wayward parents back together.

movies.title: Payback (1999)
movies.description: After a successful heist, Porter is left for dead. Once he recovers, he seeks vengeance and wants his share of the money.

movies.title: A Perfect Murder (1998)
movies.description: Wealthy Wall Street speculator Steven Taylor finds that his wife Emily Bradford has a lover, struggling artist David Shaw. Steven investigates Shaw and manipulates him into murdering Emily. It seems like a perfect crime.

movies.title: Permanent Midnight (1998)
movies.description: A comedy writer struggles to overcome his addiction to heroin while putting his professional and personal life in danger.

movies.title: Pleasantville (1998)
movies.description: Two 1990s teenage siblings find themselves transported to a 1950s sitcom where their influence begins to profoundly change that colorless, complacent world.

movies.title: Practical Magic (1998)
movies.description: Two witch sisters, raised by their eccentric aunts in a small town, face closed-minded prejudice and a curse which threatens to prevent them ever finding lasting love.

movies.title: A Price Above Rubies (1998)
movies.description: This movie is about a young woman who is married to a devout Jew and the problems that trouble their marriage because of her wanting something more out of her life.

movies.title: The Prince of Egypt (1998)
movies.description: Egyptian Prince Moses learns of his identity as a Hebrew and his destiny to become the chosen deliverer of his people.

movies.title: Pushing Tin (1999)
movies.description: A feud develops between two air traffic controllers: one cocky and determined while the other is restrained and laidback, which inevitably affects their lives.

movies.title: Quest for Camelot (1998)
movies.description: An adventurous girl, a young blind hermit, and a goofy two-headed dragon race to find the lost sword Excalibur to save King Arthur and Camelot from disaster.

movies.title: The Red Violin (1998)
movies.description: A red-colored violin inspires passion, making its way through three centuries over several owners and countries, eventually ending up at an auction where it may find a new owner.

movies.title: Resident Evil (2002)
movies.description: A special military unit fights a powerful, out-of-control supercomputer and hundreds of scientists who have mutated into flesh-eating creatures after a laboratory accident.

movies.title: Rush Hour (1998)
movies.description: A loyal and dedicated Hong Kong Inspector teams up with a reckless and loudmouthed L.A.P.D. detective to rescue the Chinese Consul's kidnapped daughter, while trying to arrest a dangerous crime lord along the way.

movies.title: Safe Men (1998)
movies.description: Two bad singers are mistaken for top safe-crackers at a bar; a gangster boss orders them to break into three safes or else.

movies.title: Saving Private Ryan (1998)
movies.description: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

movies.title: Senseless (1998)
movies.description: A student gets his senses enhanced by an experimental drug. But abuse is not an option.

movies.title: The Impostors (1998)
movies.description: Wrongly accused of physically abusing a fellow actor, starving thespians Arthur and Maurice find themselves pursued by the law aboard a cruise ship.

movies.title: The Shipping News (2001)
movies.description: An emotionally beaten man with his young daughter moves to his ancestral home in Newfoundland to reclaim his life.

movies.title: Six Days Seven Nights (1998)
movies.description: Robin Monroe, a New York magazine editor, and the gruff pilot Quinn Harris must put aside their mutual dislike if they are to survive after crash landing on a deserted South Seas island.

movies.title: Slums of Beverly Hills (1998)
movies.description: In 1976, a lower-middle-class teenager struggles to cope living with her neurotic family of nomads on the outskirts of Beverly Hills.

movies.title: Snake Eyes (1998)
movies.description: Corrupt Atlantic City police officer Rick Santoro and Navy Commander Kevin Dunn join forces to investigate both the assassination of Secretary of Defense Charles Kirkland and the disappearance of a beautiful stranger.

movies.title: Snow Falling on Cedars (1999)
movies.description: A Japanese-American fisherman is accused of killing his neighbor at sea. In the 1950s, race figures into the trial. So does reporter Ishmael.

movies.title: A Soldier's Daughter Never Cries (1998)
movies.description: This fictionalized story, based on the family life of writer James Jones, is an emotionless slice-of-life story. Jones here is portrayed as Bill Willis, a former war hero and now successful author who obviously drinks too much and is starting to experience health problems.

movies.title: Lost & Found (1999)
movies.description: In order to impress his beautiful French neighbor, Dylan Ramsey dognaps her pet pooch so he can return him and become a hero. Unfortunately, things do not work out as planned.

movies.title: Sour Grapes (1998)
movies.description: Evan and Ritchie see their friendship go sour after one wins a slots jackpot with two quarters bummed from the other.

movies.title: Species II (1998)
movies.description: An astronaut gets infected with alien DNA during the first mission on Mars and runs amok on earth. Preston and Laura team up with a peaceful, genetically re-engineered Sil to track the monster down.

movies.title: Star Trek: Insurrection (1998)
movies.description: When the crew of the Enterprise learn of a Federation conspiracy against the inhabitants of a unique planet, Captain Picard begins an open rebellion.

movies.title: Tarzan (1999)
movies.description: A man raised by gorillas must decide where he really belongs when he discovers he is a human.

movies.title: Tarzan and the Lost City (1998)
movies.description: Tarzan returns to his homeland of Africa to save his home from destruction.

movies.title: Tea with Mussolini (1999)
movies.description: An orphaned Italian boy is raised amongst a circle of British and American women living in Mussolini's Italy before and during World War II.

movies.title: Telling You (1998)
movies.description: Two college graduates who find themselves stuck behind the counter of a pizza parlor while their friends move on struggle to find a new direction for their lives.

movies.title: The Theory of Flight (1998)
movies.description: Two miserable people find happiness together: a man dreaming of flying, and a woman dreaming of living.

movies.title: The Thin Red Line (1998)
movies.description: Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.

movies.title: This Is My Father (1998)
movies.description: A middle-aged teacher discovers photos from his mother's past that convinces him that she has not told the truth about his real father. Venturing into Ireland where he believes his real father to be, a past romance slowly unfolds.

movies.title: Titus (1999)
movies.description: Titus returns victorious from war, only to plant the seeds of future turmoil for himself and his family.

movies.title: Jerry and Tom (1998)
movies.description: Tom and Jerry are two hit men, they work by day at a third-rate second-hand car dealership. Tom is a veteran and Jerry is a novice in their business, and their attitude toward their profession differs a lot. It shows when Tom is required to kill his old friend Karl.
